issue.title: Help Reconstructing Smooth Objects
issue.body: ### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware Pulled from openMVG and openMVS repo two weeks back Ubuntu 18 Hardware - Cameras in fixed position; object places on white background / floor; photos taken from multiple angles (angles are always the same due to fixed setup) ### Steps to reproduce the problem Objects with smooth surfaces are not getting reconstructed correctly. Firstly, I'll admit I only have high level understanding of the full openMVG + openMVS process - msot of the math goes above my head. ### What I Am Trying To Do: Reconstruct a soft drink bottle from 80 photos. Using script mentioned here for end to end reconsturction. ### What Is My Problem: Output is not good, especially the portions where surfaces are plain. ### What I Have Tried: Placing some markers on the rotating floor to help differentiate each pose. Output mesh still has lot of holes. ### Questions: 1) Is there a way I can do the mesh creation and texture creation from different data sets ? I have considered maybe marking the bottle so its not plain, have the mesh created correctly, then have the system use different set of images (assume the poses will be direct one to one mapping between both data sets) so they can be textured correctly. I have no idea how to do this. 2) Can I use a highly textured object to reconsturct a mesh, use the known poses of the camera for the new object (I know I can use the StructureFromKnownPoses for this, will have to figure out workflow) ? Will this improve the texture of smooth surfaced objects ? 3) Will having just newspapers on the ground matter for the textures of plain surfaces on the object ? Any other suggestions on how to do this would also be greatly appreciated. Also, please let me know if it makes more sense to have this discussion on the openMVG repo. Screenshot of output - ![Frooti](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10094226/73934955-80a23680-4905-11ea-9d37-967a077723d0.jpeg)

issue.title: openMVS support gray images?
issue.body: How to modify the code of openMVS that it can support gray images(one channel,8bits)?

issue.title: Viewer fails to display the texture of the obj model
issue.body:
I have encountered with the problem of displaying the textures, while the viewer logs tells all the needed files were loaded successfully, including .obj of 5.4 GB, .mtl of  173 bytes and .jpg of 93.7 MB.
The Viewer module works normally when displaying .obj with a small .jpg textures images, is there any restricts setting about the texture image?
![Screenshot from 2020-01-07 22-28-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25864947/71902557-49712600-319d-11ea-98b0-1394193ef176.png)

issue.body:
Like this scene：
![wire](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9250491/72727189-488cbb00-3bc5-11ea-9185-3a66f41b33c8.png)
I tried to use the openMVS to calculate the point cloud of wire tower and wire. But the result is not good.  There is no point cloud of wire. Which parameters should I modify to get good results?

issue.title: Fragmented faces in texture mapping cause blurriness and texture error
issue.body:
Hello,

In the OpenMVS TextureMesh program, we noticed many texture regions of the generated model containing either a small number of faces (or a single face), or an 'island' where a group of faces are mapped to one image, but all surrounding faces are mapped to a different image. Please see the screenshot below, on the left, using MeshLab to show texture seams.

![oldnewbluelaxt](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7981417/40687374-46a740e4-634f-11e8-86c9-46ff691b0e19.png)

We have been working on an option to remap these islands to the surrounding texture region by modifying the label selections after labels are extracted from the inference step in SceneTexture.cpp:FaceViewSelection(), but before texture patches are actually created in GenerateTexture(). We've had reasonable success (right side of screenshot).

Additional improvements we are working on require that for a given face, finding all of its valid labels. We were thinking of iterating through the face's data in FaceDataViewArr facesDatas, but are not sure how a view ID and a face's label are connected (if at all). We would greatly appreciate If you have any hints/pointers to the class relationships!

Also, we would be happy to submit the code back to you if you think it would be useful to others.

Thank you in advance..

Oh Tepmongkol-Wheaton


### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware
System: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
OpenMVG: v1.1-329-gdb92617  ( db92617fea420363abcbad1cb3773706f75012ad )
OpenMVS: v0.7-22-g939033c ( 939033c55b50478339084431aac2c2318041afad )

### Steps to reproduce the problem
Command lines to reproduce:
1) openMVG_main_SfMInit_ImageListing -i ../Images -o ./mvgMatch -d sensor_width_camera_database.txt -k '2.5741200457829959e+03;0;9.6820590653514193e+02;0.0; 2.5741200457829959e+03;1.2809532405422367e+03;0.0;0.0;1.0'
2) openMVG_main_ComputeFeatures -i ./mvgMatch/sfm_data.json -o ./mvgMatch -f 1 -m AKAZE_FLOAT -p HIGH 
3) openMVG_main_ComputeMatches -i ./mvgMatch/sfm_data.json -o ./mvgMatch -f 1 
4) openMVG_main_IncrementalSfM -i ./mvgMatch/sfm_data.json -m ./mvgMatch -o ./mvgReconstruction 
5) openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat -i ./mvgReconstruction/sfm_data.bin -I -V -E -o ./mvgReconstruction/sfm_data_cameras.json 
6) DensifyPointCloud --input-file ./mvs/scene.mvs --estimate-normals 1 --resolution-level 1 
7) ReconstructMesh ./mvs/scene_dense.mvs 
8) RefineMesh ./mvs/scene_dense_mesh.mvs --resolution-level 1 --max-views 8 --scales 3 --decimate 0.10 
9) TextureMesh ./mvs/scene_dense_mesh_refine.mvs --cost-smoothness-ratio 1 --export-type obj --resolution-level 0

issue.title: Using image masks in openMVS
issue.body:
Bonjour Pierre & Cdc

Continuing my journey down the pipeline :)

Looking at various mesh-reconstructing programs, I found out that PMVS v2 could use image masks to accelerate the process.
Is this something possible with openMVS ?
Or did I miss something and masks applied in openMVG_main_ComputeMatches make their way to the end (in the bin or mvs file) ?

Thanks again for your help.
Julien

issue.title: fix zero index normals in obj export
issue.body:
That should output obj files without 0 indices for normals in case there exists no normals.
It seems like i dont have to modify the obj reader as you check for the case of only vertices and texture coordinate indices.

issue.title: Generated obj from TextureMesh has invalid format as does not contain any normals but used index 0 for null normal index
issue.body:
### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware

While the save function supports exporting normals to an obj file, the resulting obj files that i get do not contain any normals. See https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS/blob/master/libs/IO/OBJ.cpp#L123

According to the documentation vertex normal indices should start at 1, but the vertice indices in the resulting obj files contain a 0 index, which can cause crashes on some obj readers, like the one from openscenegraph. (See discussion https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/osg-users/BBUYMYiWGl8) fixed with workaround in https://github.com/openscenegraph/OpenSceneGraph/commit/2b9c501e18b6eded7375c0e272aff401ad9793a2 

So there are two questions/options:

A) In case of no normals, just save faces to the obj as follows: 
f v1/vt1 v2/vt2 v3/vt3 ...  

instead of 

f v1/vt1/vn1 v2/vt2/vn2 v3/vt3/vn3 ...

B) Investigate, why there are no normals available. Is this intended behavior? @cdcseacave 


### Steps to reproduce the problem

I used a script using an openMVS artifact from September 2019. But i dont see any commits adressing this issue.

::These parameters are specific to computer

::Store current Directory:
set currDir=%CD%

::get folder name as variable
SET "MYDIR=%~p0"
set MYDIR1=%MYDIR:~0,-1%
for %%f in (%MYDIR1%) do set myfolder=%%~nxf

:: Set colmap directory (change this to where you've downloaded colmap, replace 'dev' with version number if necessary):
set colDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\COLMAP\colmap.exe

:: Set openMVS directory (change this to where you've downloaded openMVS)
set oMVS=E:\ReconstructionScript\OpenMVS

:: Set Working Directory (I create a temporary folder on my D drive to process data in)
set workDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\Data

:: mkdir %workDir% 
:: copy *.jpg %workDir%\ 
::cd /d %workDir%

%colDir% feature_extractor --database_path database.db --image_path .
%colDir% exhaustive_matcher --database_path database.db
mkdir sparse
%colDir% mapper --database_path %workDir%\database.db --image_path . --export_path %workDir%\sparse
%colDir% model_converter --input_path sparse\0 --output_path model.nvm --output_type NVM
%oMVS%\InterfaceVisualSFM.exe model.nvm
%oMVS%\DensifyPointCloud.exe model.mvs
%oMVS%\ReconstructMesh.exe model_dense.mvs
%oMVS%\RefineMesh.exe --resolution-level 1 model_dense_mesh.mvs
%oMVS%\TextureMesh.exe --empty-color 0 --export-type obj -o %myfolder%.obj model_dense_mesh_refine.mvs

My ENV:
```console
➜  openMVS git:(master) ✗ uname -a

No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
Release:	18.04
Codename:	bionic
➜  openMVS git:(master) ✗ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 7.4.0-1ubuntu1~18.04.1) 7.4.0
Copyright (C) 2017 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

```

issue.title: Generated obj from TextureMesh has invalid format as does not contain any normals but used index 0 for null normal index
issue.body:
### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware

While the save function supports exporting normals to an obj file, the resulting obj files that i get do not contain any normals. See https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS/blob/master/libs/IO/OBJ.cpp#L123

According to the documentation vertex normal indices should start at 1, but the vertice indices in the resulting obj files contain a 0 index, which can cause crashes on some obj readers, like the one from openscenegraph. (See discussion https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/osg-users/BBUYMYiWGl8) fixed with workaround in https://github.com/openscenegraph/OpenSceneGraph/commit/2b9c501e18b6eded7375c0e272aff401ad9793a2 

So there are two questions/options:

A) In case of no normals, just save faces to the obj as follows: 
f v1/vt1 v2/vt2 v3/vt3 ...  

instead of 

f v1/vt1/vn1 v2/vt2/vn2 v3/vt3/vn3 ...

B) Investigate, why there are no normals available. Is this intended behavior? @cdcseacave 


### Steps to reproduce the problem

I used a script using an openMVS artifact from September 2019. But i dont see any commits adressing this issue.

::These parameters are specific to computer

::Store current Directory:
set currDir=%CD%

::get folder name as variable
SET "MYDIR=%~p0"
set MYDIR1=%MYDIR:~0,-1%
for %%f in (%MYDIR1%) do set myfolder=%%~nxf

:: Set colmap directory (change this to where you've downloaded colmap, replace 'dev' with version number if necessary):

::cd /d %workDir%

%colDir% exhaustive_matcher --database_path database.db

(See discussion https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/osg-users/BBUYMYiWGl8) fixed with workaround in https://github.com/openscenegraph/OpenSceneGraph/commit/2b9c501e18b6eded7375c0e272aff401ad9793a2 

So there are two questions/options:

A) In case of no normals, just save faces to the obj as follows:

f v1/vt1/vn1 v2/vt2/vn2 v3/vt3/vn3 ...

set currDir=%CD%

::get folder name as variable
SET "MYDIR=%~p0"
set MYDIR1=%MYDIR:~0,-1%
for %%f in (%MYDIR1%) do set myfolder=%%~nxf

:: Set colmap directory (change this to where you've downloaded colmap, replace 'dev' with version number if necessary):
set colDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\COLMAP\colmap.exe

:: Set openMVS directory (change this to where you've downloaded openMVS)
set oMVS=E:\ReconstructionScript\OpenMVS

:: Set Working Directory (I create a temporary folder on my D drive to process data in)
set workDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\Data

:: mkdir %workDir% 
:: copy *.jpg %workDir%\ 
::cd /d %workDir%

%colDir% feature_extractor --database_path database.db --image_path .
%colDir% exhaustive_matcher --database_path database.db
mkdir sparse
%colDir% mapper --database_path %workDir%\database.db --image_path . --export_path %workDir%\sparse
%colDir% model_converter --input_path sparse\0 --output_path model.nvm --output_type NVM
%oMVS%\InterfaceVisualSFM.exe model.nvm
%oMVS%\DensifyPointCloud.exe model.mvs
%oMVS%\ReconstructMesh.exe model_dense.mvs
%oMVS%\RefineMesh.exe --resolution-level 1 model_dense_mesh.mvs
%oMVS%\TextureMesh.exe --empty-color 0 --export-type obj -o %myfolder%.obj model_dense_mesh_refine.mvs

issue.title: Generated obj from TextureMesh has invalid format as does not contain any normals but used index 0 for null normal index
issue.body:
### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware

While the save function supports exporting normals to an obj file, the resulting obj files that i get do not contain any normals. See https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS/blob/master/libs/IO/OBJ.cpp#L123

According to the documentation vertex normal indices should start at 1, but the vertice indices in the resulting obj files contain a 0 index, which can cause crashes on some obj readers, like the one from openscenegraph. (See discussion https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/osg-users/BBUYMYiWGl8) fixed with workaround in https://github.com/openscenegraph/OpenSceneGraph/commit/2b9c501e18b6eded7375c0e272aff401ad9793a2 

So there are two questions/options:

A) In case of no normals, just save faces to the obj as follows: 
f v1/vt1 v2/vt2 v3/vt3 ...  

instead of 

f v1/vt1/vn1 v2/vt2/vn2 v3/vt3/vn3 ...

B) Investigate, why there are no normals available. Is this intended behavior? @cdcseacave 


### Steps to reproduce the problem

I used a script using an openMVS artifact from September 2019. But i dont see any commits adressing this issue.

::These parameters are specific to computer

::Store current Directory:
set currDir=%CD%

::get folder name as variable
SET "MYDIR=%~p0"
set MYDIR1=%MYDIR:~0,-1%
for %%f in (%MYDIR1%) do set myfolder=%%~nxf

:: Set colmap directory (change this to where you've downloaded colmap, replace 'dev' with version number if necessary):
set colDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\COLMAP\colmap.exe

:: Set openMVS directory (change this to where you've downloaded openMVS)
set oMVS=E:\ReconstructionScript\OpenMVS

:: Set Working Directory (I create a temporary folder on my D drive to process data in)
set workDir=E:\ReconstructionScript\Data

:: mkdir %workDir% 
:: copy *.jpg %workDir%\ 
::cd /d %workDir%

%colDir% feature_extractor --database_path database.db --image_path .
%colDir% exhaustive_matcher --database_path database.db
mkdir sparse
%colDir% mapper --database_path %workDir%\database.db --image_path . --export_path %workDir%\sparse
%colDir% model_converter --input_path sparse\0 --output_path model.nvm --output_type NVM
%oMVS%\InterfaceVisualSFM.exe model.nvm
%oMVS%\DensifyPointCloud.exe model.mvs
%oMVS%\ReconstructMesh.exe model_dense.mvs
%oMVS%\RefineMesh.exe --resolution-level 1 model_dense_mesh.mvs
%oMVS%\TextureMesh.exe --empty-color 0 --export-type obj -o %myfolder%.obj model_dense_mesh_refine.mvs

issue.title: fix CMakeLits.txt for CMake older than 3.7
issue.body:
Hi.

I tried to build this project on Ubuntu 16.04, using CMake 3.5.1. When I ran cmake, I got this error.

```
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:68 (if):
  if given arguments:

    "CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID" "MATCHES" "AppleClang" "AND" "CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_VERSION" "VERSION_GREATER_EQUAL" "7.0"

  Unknown arguments specified


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

It seems that "VERSION_GREATER_EQUAL" opeation became available only after CMake version 3.7.x.

This pull request, folloing a [precedent](https://bitbucket.org/ompl/ompl/commits/6b661013f090389f691a6bdabe8b61936a52e428), will circumvent the error.

issue.title: Unable to load scene when using RefineMesh
issue.body:
Hi! Thank you for sharing this awesome project! Lately I tried to use the Refinemesh application. I used the **openMVS_sample** provided by you as input. I tried to refine the coarse mesh with **scene_mesh.mvs**.   However it failed to load the scene. The output is given:

- 14:45:24 [App     ] Build date: Jan  6 2020, 14:32:29
- 14:45:24 [App     ] CPU: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2630 v3 @ 2.40GHz
- 14:45:24 [App     ] RAM: 251.84GB Physical Memory 23.25GB Virtual Memory
- 14:45:24 [App     ] OS: Linux 3.16.0-30-generic (x86_64)
- 14:45:24 [App     ] SSE & AVX compatible CPU & OS detected
- 14:45:24 [App     ] Command line: /mnt/D/shengxin_exp/openMVS_build/openMVS_sample_master/scene_mesh.mvs

It turned out the code ended with EXIT_FAILURE in RefineMesh.cpp, line 227:	
```
if (!scene.Load(MAKE_PATH_SAFE(OPT::strInputFileName)))
    return EXIT_FAILURE;
```
The code is compiled on Ubuntu 16.04 and the DensifyPointCloud works well. How should I fix this problem? Thanks a lot!

issue.title: Densification - Discarding points with depths farther than 1m
issue.body:
Hello, Is there any way I can discard depths equivalent to 1m in real life? I'm trying to do a reconstruction but the scale of the important structure is too small because it's also reconstructing the ceiling. Here's an example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5957673/57227005-a023d000-7010-11e9-895f-ce2fa941010c.png)

When I'm really just interested in this area:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5957673/57227055-bf226200-7010-11e9-813e-d626978d5c22.png)

I noticed that in the fusion step there's a conditional for discarding depths that are equal to zero, usually I would add my condition there but I don't know what the depth values represent, meters, mm?
